notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Service Mesh 2.1.3 has been released.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Critical. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Service Mesh is a Red Hat distribution of the Istio service mesh project, tailored for installation into an on-premise OpenShift Container Platform installation.

This advisory covers the RPM packages for the release.

Security Fix(es):

* envoy: oauth filter allows trivial bypass (CVE-2022-29226)
* envoy: Decompressors can be zip bombed (CVE-2022-29225)
* envoy: oauth filter calls continueDecoding() from within decodeHeaders() (CVE-2022-29228)
* golang: math/big: uncontrolled memory consumption due to an unhandled overflow via Rat.SetString (CVE-2022-23772)
* golang: cmd/go: misinterpretation of branch names can lead to incorrect access control (CVE-2022-23773)
* golang: crypto/elliptic IsOnCurve returns true for invalid field elements (CVE-2022-23806)
* envoy: Segfault in GrpcHealthCheckerImpl (CVE-2022-29224)
* Istio: Unsafe memory access in metadata exchange (CVE-2022-31045)

For more details about the security issues, including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, see the CVE page listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in the big package of the math library in golang. The Rat.SetString could cause an overflow, and if left unhandled, it could lead to excessive memory use. This issue could allow a remote attacker to impact the availability of the system.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: math/big: uncontrolled memory consumption due to an unhandled overflow via Rat.SetString
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 and 9 are affected, because the code-base is affected by this vulnerability.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Moderate security impact, and the issue is not currently planned to be addressed in future updates for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7, hence, marked as Out-of-Support-Scope. 

For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/ and Red Hat Enterprise Linux Life Cycle & Updates Policy: https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/errata/.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: The OpenShift Service Mesh Release Notes provide information on the features and known issues. See the link in the References section.

vulnerabilities.title: golang: math/big: uncontrolled memory consumption due to an unhandled overflow via Rat.SetString

notes.text: A flaw was found in the go package of the cmd library in golang. The go command could be tricked into accepting a branch, which resembles a version tag. This issue could allow a remote unauthenticated attacker to bypass security restrictions and introduce invalid or incorrect tags, reducing the integrity of the environment.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: cmd/go: misinterpretation of branch names can lead to incorrect access control
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: The OpenShift Service Mesh Release Notes provide information on the features and known issues. See the link in the References section.

vulnerabilities.title: golang: cmd/go: misinterpretation of branch names can lead to incorrect access control

notes.text: A flaw was found in the elliptic package of the crypto library in golang when the IsOnCurve function could return true for invalid field elements. This flaw allows an attacker to take advantage of this undefined behavior, affecting the availability and integrity of the resource.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: crypto/elliptic: IsOnCurve returns true for invalid field elements
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 and 9 are affected because the code-base is affected by this vulnerability.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having a Moderate security impact. The issue is not currently planned to be addressed in future updates for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7; hence, marked as Out-of-Support-Scope. 

Red Hat Developer Tools - Compilers (go-toolset-1.16 & 1.17), will not be addressed in future updates as shipped only in RHEL-7, hence, marked as Out-of-Support-Scope.

For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/ and Red Hat Enterprise Linux Life Cycle & Updates Policy: https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/errata/.
notes.title: Statement

vulnerabilities.title: golang: crypto/elliptic: IsOnCurve returns true for invalid field elements

notes.text: A flaw was found in Envoy. This flaw allows an attacker who controls an upstream host and also controls service discovery of that host (via DNS, the EDS API, etc.) to crash Envoy by forcing the removal of the host from service discovery and then failing the gRPC health check request. This issue crashes Envoy via a NULL pointer dereference.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: envoy: Segfault in GrpcHealthCheckerImpl
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: The OpenShift Service Mesh Release Notes provide information on the features and known issues. See the link in the References section.
Disable gRPC health checking and/or replace it with a different health checking type.

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Highly Compressed Data (Data Amplification)

notes.text: A flaw was found in Envoy. A specifically constructed HTTP body delivered by an untrusted downstream or upstream peer whose decompressed size is dramatically larger than the compressed size can be sent by an attacker to cause a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: envoy: Decompressors can be zip bombed
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: The OpenShift Service Mesh Release Notes provide information on the features and known issues. See the link in the References section.
This can be mitigated by disabling decompression in Envoy.

vulnerabilities.title: envoy: Decompressors can be zip bombed

notes.text: A flaw was found in Envoy. The OAuth filter does not include an implementation for validating access tokens, allowing remote attackers to bypass authentication to Envoy by providing any token value.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: envoy: oauth filter allows trivial bypass
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: The OpenShift Service Mesh Release Notes provide information on the features and known issues. See the link in the References section.
There is no known mitigation for this flaw.

vulnerabilities.title: envoy: oauth filter allows trivial bypass

notes.text: A flaw was found in Envoy. The OAuth filter would try to invoke the remaining filters in the chain after emitting a local response, which triggers an ASSERT() in newer versions and corrupts memory on earlier versions.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: envoy: oauth filter calls continueDecoding() from within decodeHeaders()
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: The OpenShift Service Mesh Release Notes provide information on the features and known issues. See the link in the References section.

vulnerabilities.title: envoy: oauth filter calls continueDecoding() from within decodeHeaders()

notes.text: A flaw was found in Istio. Memory access violation of ill-formed headers sent to Envoy in certain configurations can lead to unexpected memory access, resulting in undefined behavior or crashing.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Istio: Unsafe memory access in metadata exchange.
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability
